text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Colecovision is a second generation video game console marketed by Coleco (Connecticut Leather Company) and released in August 1982. Equipped with a 3.58 Mhz processor, 1 kb of RAM, 3 tone and 1 noise generators, it displays a Resolution of 256x192 pixels and 32 sprites in 16 colors. This enables it to offer graphics similar to arcade games of the time. About 170 titles were released during his lifetime, and it still continues to allow Homebrew in 2020. Coleco has also marketed a module that makes the console compatible with the Atari 2600.
